entities.name: harry
entities.description: The main character of the story, mentioned as someone who is taking exams.

entities.name: voldemort
entities.description: A villainous character, mentioned as a potential threat to Harry.

entities.name: fluffy
entities.description: A dog that is being kept behind a locked door, and is still alive and well.

entities.name: professor flitwick
entities.description: A teacher who is conducting practical exams, including making a pineapple tap-dance across a desk.

entities.name: professor mcgonagall
entities.description: A teacher who is watching students turn a mouse into a snuff-box during the practical exams.

entities.name: snape
entities.description: A teacher who is making students nervous while they try to remember how to make a Forgetfulness Potion.

relationships.description: Harry has a fear of Voldemort bursting through the door at any moment, as mentioned in the text: 'he half expected Voldemort to come bursting through the door at any moment'.
Harry is concerned about Fluffy's well-being, as mentioned in the text: 'Yet the days crept by and there could be no doubt that Fluffy was still alive and well behind the locked door'.

Professor Flitwick is conducting practical exams with his students, as mentioned in the text: 'Professor Flitwick called them one by one into his class to see if they could make a pineapple tap-dance across a desk'.
Professor McGonagall is watching students during the practical exams, as mentioned in the text: 'Professor McGonagall watched them turn a mouse into a snuff-box'.
Snape is making students nervous while they try to remember how to make a Forgetfulness Potion, as mentioned in the text: 'Snape made them all nervous, breathing down their necks'.
